thread.title: Manchester United transfer news: Wayne Rooney should not be sold now, says Gary Neville | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United transfer news: Wayne Rooney should not be sold now, says Gary Neville | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United transfer news: Wayne Rooney should not be sold now, says Gary Neville | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 3:44 pm Wayne Rooney is being linked with a surprise exit this month (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United would be taking a major risk selling Wayne Rooney to a Chinese Super League club at this stage of the season, according to Gary Neville. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The England international has been strongly linked with a shock move to China before their transfer window closes next Tuesday, but Neville thinks it would be unwise by the Red Devils. 
United are still competing in four competitions this season as they aim for a top four finish in the Premier League whilst also looking to win the EFL Cup, Europa League and FA Cup. Rooney recently became United’s all-time leading goalscorer (Picture: Getty) 
Having already sold Memphis Depay and Morgan Schneiderlin in January, Neville feels United losing Rooney now would put them at real risk of a majorly depleted squad if they were to pick up any injuries between now and May. 
‘I would like to think Rooney would stay at Manchester United,’ Neville told Sky Sports. 
‘It is strange timing – the (English) transfer window is over and yet there is this debate when there is still two months of the season to go. That seems odd. There is still a contribution to be made and many trophies to be played for and won at United.
